result.execSummary:
The defendant John L. Beranek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT Schooling or a combination thereof if deemed physically able, or for any time he does not meet that requirement defendant must complete 10 hours community service per week if deemed physically able.

Successfully complete SAFE program intake and any follow up. 
Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes:
I&S for rules violations.
With huber for work, treatment, community service, and medical.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:37am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - written victim statement filed.

Atty Bohn makes requests regarding financial obligations for this case be reduced.

State moves to:
Ct. 2 (CDTP/DA)>>D&R
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Battery/DA)>>GUILTY
Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on each count, 1 year probation on each count, concurrent
CONDITIONS: Ct.1--30 days MCJ w/huber for work/treatment/c.s./medical, I&S to be used for any rules violations; Absolute sobriety; Successfully complete SAFE program intake and any follow up recommended; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; GFE To obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof if deemed physically able, or for any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must perform 10 hours of community service if deemed physically able by PO; DNA sample and surcharge on Ct. 1 -- COURT remits DNA surcharge on Ct. 3; CC including 2 domestic abuse surcharges.

>>If revoked, credit for 1 day of time served on each count.

Adj: 8:47am

Pre-trial conference at 02-12-2016 09:00 am.
Plea hearing at 03-11-2016 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 04-14-2016 09:00 am.
Jury Trial at 05-04-2016 08:15 am.

No contact with victim(s):  G.A.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings (Wausau PD).
